intro: Elatostema pachycephalum, commonly known as the thick-headed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Elatostema pachycephalum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
